subject: Public Speaking
title: Hannibal Rallies His Army at the Alps
description: A micro-lesson that makes Hannibal Rallies His Army at the Alps usable.

hook.text: Hannibal stood at the base of the Alps with 50,000 soldiers, 9,000 horses, and 37 war elephants.

buildup.text: His men saw snow-capped peaks and nearly mutinied. Crossing seemed impossible â€” and it nearly was.

discovery.text: Hannibal pointed toward Italy and told them Rome's riches waited on the other side. Fear met greed.

twist.text: Half his army died during the crossing. But the survivors emerged behind Roman lines â€” completely unexpected.

climax.text: The speech didn't guarantee survival. It guaranteed commitment. That was enough to change the war.

punchline.text: He couldn't promise safety. He promised glory.

quiz.question: How did Hannibal motivate his army to cross the Alps?
options: He promised Rome's riches on the other side
